content: green single_crochet 2hdc single_crochet slip_stitch fo weave in ends join yarn on the cap above the other moss and crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet 3dc half_double_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch fo weave in ends as you can see i crocheted moss on different parts of the cycloom s body sometimes using more sts other times less but of course you don t have to do it exactly that way @thenickcole 10 crocheted eye be sure to use a smaller crochet hook otherwise the eye will be too big i used a 2mm hook black pink purple white and body colour yarn light pink and yellow embroidery thread start with black 1 magic_ring 6sc = 6 2 increase*6 = 12 now change to pink 3 single_crochet increase *6 = 18 now change to purple 4 2sc 1spikest *6 = 18 now change to body colour 5 blo 18sc = 18 fo leave a tail for sewing add some highlights with light pink yellow and white see pics sew the eye over rounds 14 to 19 finished with crocheted eye @thenickcole 11 crocheted staff you can decorate the staff as you like you can also make your cycloom a staff from wire or a small stick just as you like here is the pattern to crochet one i used a 1 75 mm hook embroidery thread in dark brown and silver a small piece of wire to stabilize and a needle to do the embroidery for the top i used embroidery thread in * light blue green and pink for the fairy staff * cream and gold and silver for the one with the pointed top i also sewed some beads to the staff start with dark brown 1 magic_ring 5sc = 5 2 - 13 5sc = 5 12 rounds 14 increase*5 = 10 fo weave in end if you want to insert wire do it now otherwise the staff is not stuffed it gets stability from the embroidery fairy staff with light blue 15 in blo of round 14 single_crochet increase *5 = 15 16 - 18 15sc = 15 3 rounds 19 single_crochet decrease *5 = 10 20 decrease*5 = 5 fo weave in end with silver embroider between the rounds around the staff i used the whipped back stitch start at the bottom end see pics @thenickcole 12 when you reach the top you can wrap your silver thread around the staff several times it will give a nice edge sew the thread so that nothing slips i threaded through all the silver stitches again from top to bottom so you don t see individual stitches but a silver band in the picture you can see the difference lower part of the staff single stitches upper part like a silver band now the top can be decorated i did this the same way with green embroidery thread and then embroidered with pink french knots in between if you want to make a pointed top you crochet rounds 1 to 14 the same
